Key Match Events: Boston collected their rings, hung a banner, and had plenty of energy left to dismantle the new-look Knicks.
The Celtics took a massive 43-24 lead at the end of the 1st quarter, and never even hinted at the possibility of letting the lead slip away.
Pre-Game Insights: None of these factors mattered for Boston. If anything, these circumstances and the thought that the Knicks wanted this to be a statement game seemed to have fueled the Celtics.
Post-Match Reflections: Jayson Tatum was flat out special in this game. He finished with 37 points and 10 assists.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Celtics had a busy offseason, with players flying all over the globe for various reasons. The team made it back early for training camp, and had a productive preseason, but they had every reason to start off slow in their first real game.
Others: Boston didn't have a shiny new addition to the rotation, but that didn't stop Mazzulla from making a slight tweak to his rotation.
Derrick White, the Celtics 2nd leading scoring, was his typical exceptional two-way self in this contest.
Jrue Holiday, the Celtics' point guard, had a solid game with 14 points, 7 rebounds, and 6 assists.
Jaylen Brown had a strong game with 20 points, 5 rebounds, and 3 steals.
The Celtics' bench provided a significant contribution, with Payton Pritchard scoring 12 points off the bench.
